body:
Yesterday i upgrade flutter 1.12.13+hotfix.5 and android studio 3.5.3, when i open flutter project with android studio, it's abnormal. android studio auto open flutter's android project, but it's error and can't close.(Then I upgraded it to 3.6 rc1, same problem)

![20201229112803](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11717694/71552008-6afc4000-2a2e-11ea-89bf-7d26347adcf9.jpg)
![20201229112838](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11717694/71552009-6afc4000-2a2e-11ea-8937-f33cb9dff104.jpg)

flutter doctor -v

```
[âœ“] Flutter (Channel stable, v1.12.13+hotfix.5, on Mac OS X 10.15.2 19C57,
    locale zh-Hans-CN)
    â€¢ Flutter version 1.12.13+hotfix.5 at /Users/kamy/flutter
    â€¢ Framework revision 27321ebbad (3 weeks ago), 2019-12-10 18:15:01 -0800

[âœ“] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 29.0.2)

      Studio.app/Contents/jre/jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java

      1.8.0_212-release-1586-b4-5784211)

[âœ“] Android Studio (version 3.6)
    â€¢ Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents

      1.8.0_212-release-1586-b4-5784211)

[âœ“] VS Code (version 1.41.1)
```

comment_data.body: same here, i noticed this behavior started on Android Studio 3.5.3 but dunno if it's a coincidence or something wrong on 3.5.3

> same here, i noticed this behavior started on Android Studio 3.5.3 but dunno if it's a coincidence or something wrong on 3.5.3

I went back to 3.5.1 and still have the same problem, there should be a configuration change

Hi @shijinliang 
could you please run 
`flutter clean`
`flutter pub cache repair`
let me know if the issue persists
thank you
@DanTup Should this be moved to [Dart-Code](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/)? I don't have permission.
@jmagman this is Android Studio not VS Code so I think it should go to https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij.
Yeah, I wasn't sure from the stack either - but I think those that work on the Android Studio/IntelliJ plugins would be better able to say for sure.

> Yeah, I wasn't sure from the stack either - but I think those that work on the Android Studio/IntelliJ plugins would be better able to say for sure.

When i use IntellIJ IDEA, no additional windows pops up so i think it's Android Studio problem

Also `flutter clean` and `flutter pub cache repair` didn't fix my problem. After 2nd command was executed, same 'android' windows pops up

Moved to flutter/flutter-intellij. I agree with the comment above - this may not be a flutter issue. That stack trace: looks like an issue in Android Studio itself, and not in the Flutter plugin. Can you file a bug there (https://developer.android.com/studio/report-bugs)?
I'm not sure how the NPE relates but the empty `_android` window is a dup of #4217. I think we can close this one.

title: Android studio open flutter project is abnormal
